intro: Caperonia nervosa, commonly known as the veined caper, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, featuring slender stems and small, alternate leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round pods that contain seeds. Caperonia nervosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
